newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - July 18.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - July 18.

text.p: -- Microsoft Corp reported earnings of $1.05 billion, or $0.80 per share, for its fiscal fourth quarter, up from $559 million, or $0.43 per share, a year earlier. The earnings were $0.01 better than the Wall Street consensus estimate, but the software company failed to beat the so-called "whisper numbers," which were $0.10 to $0.30 higher.
Microsoft closed at 149-1/2, then slipped to 146 in after-hours trading.

-- Sun Microsystems Inc reported fourth quarter earnings of $0.61 per share, up from $0.31 a year earlier. The First Call consensus estimate was $0.59. The computer maker's stock closed at 45-9/16, then dipped to 44-3/4 in after-hours trading.

-- Consumer products company Gillette Co posted second quarter earnings of $0.57 per share, up from $0.50 a year earlier and in line with the First Call consensus estimate. Sales grew less than one percent, to $2.29 billion. The stock closed at 101-3/8.
